alert.note: Alert for Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Leon. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Florida A And M, Doak Campbell Stadium, Florida State University, Tallahassee Comm College, Gaither Community Center, Springsax Park, North Florida Fairgrounds, Belair, Lake Munson, Bragg Stadium, Innovation Park, Lake Bradford, Leon County Civic Center, State Capital Complex, Kleman Plaza, Indian Head Acres, Tallahassee Regional A/P and Eight Mile Pond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
